body_html:
I think cmake build is configured to do exactly that, only run if 1-everything else passes, 2-it changes something in cmake folder.
I think what we want to do is just not wait for other tests, run anytime there is a change in cmake folder.

For the 2nd question. It runs inside a docker container. Inside that container, it runs as root.
Ddid you see some unexpected behaviour? I can check if there is a permissions issue on the cmake test.

body:
I think cmake build is configured to do exactly that, only run if 1-everything else passes, 2-it changes something in cmake folder. 
I think what we want to do is just not wait for other tests, run anytime there is a change in cmake folder.

For the 2nd question. It runs inside a docker container. Inside that container, it runs as root. 
Ddid you see some unexpected behaviour? I can check if there is a permissions issue on the cmake test.
